department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
short_summary: Forensic Toxicology analytical and interpretative services
description: Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) is seeking Industry feedback regarding Forensic Toxicology analytical and interpretative services for the purpose of assisting the investigations and prosecutions of drug impaired driving on behalf of The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP).
duration_in_months: As the requirement is not specified
full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement Request for Information (RFI)**
================================================================

**Reference Number:** WS4263982569-Doc4263984977

**Solicitation Number:** WS4263982569

**Publication Date:** 2023-10-17

**Tender Closing Date:** 2023-10-30T14:00:00 (Eastern Daylight Time)

**Background:**
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) seeks support from the industry to assist with the investigations and prosecutions of drug-impaired driving. To facilitate this, Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) is issuing a Request for Information (RFI) to gather feedback on forensics toxicology analytical and interpretative services.

**RFI Details:**
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding
* **Trade Agreements:** None
* **Limited Tendering Reason:** None
* **Trade Agreements Note:** This procurement is not subject to trade agreements.

**RFI Objectives:**
* Gather industry feedback on the requirements for forensics toxicology analytical and interpretative services
* Identify potential suppliers capable of providing the required services
* Develop a better understanding of the marketplace and potential solutions

**Key Details:**
* **Regions of Delivery:** Ottawa
* **Contracting Entity:** Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **End User Entities:** Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP)
* **Expected Project Start Date:** Not specified
* **Expected Project End Date:** Not specified

**Responding to this RFI:**
To respond to this RFI, please submit all required supporting documentation and responses electronically or via mail to the address provided. A confirmation email will be sent to both the sender and the contact person once the information is received.

**Point of Contact:**
For any inquiries, please contact *(Name:)* Joshua Kaine (SPAC/PSPC) via email at joshua.kaine@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca. Please include your name and contact information in the subject line to facilitate communication.

**Documentation:**
Additional resources and documentation are available on the Ariba Discovery website. Please visit the link provided to access this information. [link to announcement]
